channel.title: 24GB of disk taken by fresh install Bookworm distromorph? + other notes
channel.description:
Downloaded and verified Debian bookworm ISO. dd if=offed it to a usb stick. Installed Debian xfce to my laptops 80GB ssd. Distromorphed Kicksecure following these instructions:
trafotin com v kicksecure
When starting first time to the desktop the Disks application says 24GB used?
This cant be normal. Could some kicksecures memory security features cause this?
Sidenotes: -Installed tor browser bundle, which has now started suggesting browsing history in address bar after starting tor browser. (Computer was powered on just prior to starting tor browser.) All browsing history settings are off and tor browser default settings should prevent any browsing history carry on from previous instanses. Just mentioning this if it is related to other funnybusiness. Posting this to tor forum also. Search about it gave very little.
-Is it ok to install OpenSnitch on Kicksecure. Would like to see who is calling where. I have been using it as a comforting passifier or excuse, for years for not delving deeper into firewall and ip-taples cringe.
-CD/DVD wont play. VLC player gives error message:
-There was no calculator in applications? Installed Gnome Calculator myself.
Otherwise all is sweet so far.
Thank you for all the great work and effort you have put into this.

item.title: 24GB of disk taken by fresh install Bookworm distromorph? + other notes
item.dc:creator: johnsmith1001
item.description:
I think you are correct.

sudo du -sh /var/swapfile says:

15G /var/swapfile

How much diskspace is Bookworm Kicksecure distromorph taking?
There is still 9G unaccounted for. Ill use the baobab for that.

Have to study the thing. Know nothing about those swap files.
Thank you for the links.

Read full topic
item.source: 24GB of disk taken by fresh install Bookworm distromorph? + other notes

item.title: 24GB of disk taken by fresh install Bookworm distromorph? + other notes
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
baobab should show that.

Potentially swapfile created by swap-file-creator is too large.

  • Check Swap File Size
  • Configuration

Which was recently improved by default. (Enhanced heuristics for determining the swap file size in swap-file-creator?)

Read full topic
item.source: 24GB of disk taken by fresh install Bookworm distromorph? + other notes

item.title: 24GB of disk taken by fresh install Bookworm distromorph? + other notes
item.dc:creator: johnsmith1001
item.description:
The disk space analyser command (df -h) that was the first of its kind in the additional sowtware list you linked says:

df -h
/dev/mapper/user–vg-root Size 72G Used 41G

Of which 17G is in one folder on the desktop, where everything I have transfered to the computer since day one is located, except few self installed programs. So there is 24 G of something in the root, like there was when I logged first time to the desktop.

Can I somehow df -h myself deeper in to the root to reveal the bloating culprit?

Read full topic
item.source: 24GB of disk taken by fresh install Bookworm distromorph? + other notes

item.title: 24GB of disk taken by fresh install Bookworm distromorph? + other notes
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Disks application says 24GB used?

Disk Space
Analyzer

Sidenote: Installed tor browser which has started suggesting browsing history in address bar after starting tor browser. (Computer was powered on just prior to starting tor browser.) All browsing history settings are off and tor browser default settings should prevent any browsing history carry on from previous instanses.

Unspecific to Kicksecure.

Kicksecure – 6 Sep 24

Potential Solutions Beyond Kicksecure!

Explore resources outside of Kicksecure to address unspecific questions or issues.

Is there way to confirm things are the way they should be with the tor browser.

Not much. You can compare with Debian.

See also:

Kicksecure – 21 Sep 24

System Audit

Verifying the system is configured as intended

Farsidenote: Also there was no calculator in applications. Had to install gnome calculator myself. Is this normal?

Yes.

Morenote: Is it ok to install OpenSnitch on Kicksecure. Would like to see who is calling where. I have been using it as a comforting passifier or excuse, for years for not delving deeper into ip taples cringe.

Ok.

Not much advice available at this point. When this changes, the
following wiki page will be updated:

Kicksecure – 21 Oct 24

Host Firewall

Host Firewall Installation and Configuration

Updates will be posted here:

Kicksecure Firewall Development
What is the Firewall comes with Kicksecure on CLI? ufw was not included anywhere in any metapackage.

Read full topic
